author: @1011_news
title: York notary charged in petition fraud case argues to have it tossed
text: York notary charged in petition fraud case argues to have it tossed LINCOLN, Neb. (KOLN) - The notary public from York charged in a petition fraud case is arguing to have it tossed. Jacy Todd, 53, is facing [24 misdemeanor counts](https://www.1011now.com/2024/10/02/two-dozen-charges-filed-against-york-notary-public-petition-fraud-case/) of official misconduct for notarizing signatures gathered by Nebraskans for Medical Marijuana without the presence of [Michael Egbert](https://www.1011now.com/2024/09/13/grand-island-man-charged-after-nebraska-ag-finds-fake-signatures-medical-marijuana-petitions/). Todd’s attorney is arguing that notaries public are not government employees and therefore cannot be charged with official misconduct. They also argue that the Nebraska Legislature has designated civil penalties for those who fail to strictly follow the notarial process requirements. Hall County Court has given the Nebraska Attorney General‘s Office until Nov. 7 to file a response, and Todd’s council will have the opportunity to file a response to it by Nov. 14. The judge handling the case will then take everything under advisement and decide what happens next. In short, the State has charged Todd with crimes based on alleged acts that do not constitute a crime under Nebraska law. If the State has evidence that Todd committed intentional fraud, there are a litany of applicable criminal statutes that may be applicable. As it stands, though, the State has elected—presumably because it has no evidence of intentional fraud despite insinuating publicly that Todd’s actions were somehow more nefarious—to charge Todd with crimes based only on his purported failure to strictly follow the requirements of the notarial process—conduct the legislature chose to address only through civil remedies under Neb. Rev. Stat. §64-113. Because the State has not alleged conduct that constitutes a crime under Nebraska law, Todd’s motion to quash should be sustained and the matter promptly dismissed. Egbert is accused of fabricating 202 signatures on a few dozen petition sheets. He brought those signatures to Todd at a dispensary in Grand Island, and authorities say Todd notarized the signatures without the presence of Egbert. Egbert faces a felony count of false swearing to a circulator’s affidavit. ALSO WATCH: Night Beat with Danielle Shenk [Click here](https://www.1011now.com/newsletter/) to subscribe to our 10/11 NOW daily digest and breaking news alerts delivered straight to your email inbox. Copyright 2024 KOLN. All rights reserved.

author: mcruz79
title: Strange how little talk there's here about black myth Wukong. This game is absolutely spectacular and a marvel in regards to overall presentation. | ResetEra
text:
So, I picked this game March 15 and ended up playing every day until today.
Finally finished with almost 80 hours played, beating all type of bosses, mobs and kings.
Amount of high quality content is extremely impressive, specially if we take I. Consideration the game wasn't even sold at the traditional full price for the nowdays AAA standards.
This game is just absolutely incredible and extremely impressive tech wise.
My final impressions for me howlongtobeat review:
Absolutely incredible game.
Really hard to believe this is the first AAA game from this developers when we are seeing so many major AAA studios with millions of dollars releasing average games.
Story is a bit hard to follow for people like me not familiarize with the Journey to the west tale but even so, is very very entertaining to follow the characters because they are very well portrayed here.
Cutscenes are awesome, voice acting, the art in some scenes and overall cinematography is very impressive and enjoyable to see.
Gameplay is very good, with great combat, lots of techniques to unlock and master, awesome secrets to find, awesome places to explore and absolutely incredible and memorable boss fights.
The amount of high quality content here is extremely impressive and the game was sold at 60 dollars.
Bosses move sets, overall animations and presentation are so good and epic.
Some of the best boss fighting ever in vídeo games.
Visuals are not perfect and there's some very bad pop in in textures, vegetation and lighting, kind of typical of unreal engine games. some textures also are not at the same level as others.
Ok. Apart from this, visuals are extraordinary. Some environments are absolutely incredible and overall characters are also incredibly detailed and well realized with some impressive models and incredible work on materials and fabrics. The main start of the show is the animation work that is extremely impressive, specially for a new studio.
A subject (animations) where even veterans of the industry fail, game science really made an incredible job with many contextual and some beautifully choreographed animations.
Soundtrack is also fantastic and some tracks are truly spectacular.
Presentation of the game is almost sublime with some nitpicks like the mentioned pop in and some loading screens, but overall is absolutely incredible with some awesome camera work, impressive visuals and music and some absolutely incredible scenes and art.
I really loved this game and got extremely impressed but the overall quality of the game, even on console (Played on PS5Pro), delivered by Game science.
Finally finished with almost 80 hours played, beating all type of bosses, mobs and kings.
Amount of high quality content is extremely impressive, specially if we take I. Consideration the game wasn't even sold at the traditional full price for the nowdays AAA standards.
This game is just absolutely incredible and extremely impressive tech wise.
My final impressions for me howlongtobeat review:
Absolutely incredible game.
Really hard to believe this is the first AAA game from this developers when we are seeing so many major AAA studios with millions of dollars releasing average games.

Gameplay is very good, with great combat, lots of techniques to unlock and master, awesome secrets to find, awesome places to explore and absolutely incredible and memorable boss fights.

Ok. Apart from this, visuals are extraordinary. Some environments are absolutely incredible and overall characters are also incredibly detailed and well realized with some impressive models and incredible work on materials and fabrics. The main start of the show is the animation work that is extremely impressive, specially for a new studio.
A subject (animations) where even veterans of the industry fail, game science really made an incredible job with many contextual and some beautifully choreographed animations.

author: Chio Sánchez
title: CDMX suda la gota gorda: prevén temperaturas de hasta 33 grados; activan alertas
text: CDMX suda la gota gorda: prevén temperaturas de hasta 33 grados; activan alertas La CDMX está viviendo días con mucho calor. Toma precauciones y checa el pronóstico del clima para hoy y el finde. Por: Chio Sánchez ¿Tienes plan de salidita para este fin de semana? Es mejor que cheques cómo seguirá el calor en la CDMX y el Edomex, pues se prevé que el Sol esté con todo. Ante este calorón que derrite a las y los chilangos, las autoridades de la Ciudad de México activaron dos alertas por altas temperaturas para 14 alcaldías. O sea, tanto la alerta amarilla y la naranja se activaron ante el calor que se prevé, ya que se esperan temperaturas de hasta 33 grados, de acuerdo con la Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y Protección Civil (SGIRPC-CDMX). En [Chilango](https://www.chilango.com/) te decimos cuál es el pronóstico del clima para este viernes 22 de marzo y hasta el domingo 24 en la CDMX y en el Edomex. [Checa también: Juez de CDMX falla a favor de Edgar Oceransky: ordena a víctima de violencia sexual disculparse con el cantante](https://www.chilango.com/ciudadania/edgar-oceransky-juez-ordena-disculpa-cdmx/) Viernes 22 de marzo: sigue el calor De acuerdo al pronóstico del clima de la Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y Protección Civil, para el día de hoy en la CDMX se espera un día muy caluroso, además de cielo despejado. ¿Y la lluvia?, sin sus luces. ¡Eso no es todo! Porque se activó la alerta amarilla y la naranja por altas temperaturas que se esperan en 12 alcaldías de la capirucha. ¡Feliz viernes!— Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y PC (@SGIRPC_CDMX) Hoy tendremos cielo mayormente despejado sin condiciones para lluvia en la capital del país. Recuerda que se activó Alerta Naranja y Alerta Amarilla por temperaturas altas en la Ciudad de México. Toma tus precauciones. [#LaPrevenciónEsNuestraFuerza] [pic.twitter.com/2nThpmiLwD] [March 22, 2024] En el Estado de México se pronostica cielo despejado y sin lluvia. Por la tarde, se percibirá un ambiente de cálido a caluroso, de acuerdo con el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional. Se prevé viento del oeste y suroeste de 15 a 30 km/h con rachas de 40 a 60 km/h y posibles tolvaneras en la región. La temperatura mínima pronosticada para la Ciudad de México será de 15 a 17 °C y la máxima de 29 a 31 °C. Para el Edomex, la temperatura mínima será de 5 a 7 °C y la máxima de 25 a 27 °C. Alerta amarilla por calor en alcaldías de CDMX Para este viernes 22 de marzo se activó la alerta amarilla así como la naranja por altas temperaturas en la capital, de acuerdo con la Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y Protección Civil. Las autoridades de la CDMX activaron la alerta amarilla para cuatro alcaldías. A continuación te decimos en qué demarcaciones se sudará la gota gorda: - Álvaro Obregón - La Magdalena Contreras - Tláhuac - Xochimilco En estas demarcaciones se esperan temperaturas altas entre los 28 a 30 °C. Alerta naranja por calor en alcaldías de CDMX Además, se activó en la CDMX la alerta naranja en 10 alcaldías. A continuación te decimos en qué demarcaciones hará más calor: - Azcapotzalco - Benito Juárez - Coyoacán - Cuauhtémoc - Gustavo A. Madero - Iztacalco - Iztapalapa - Miguel Hidalgo - Tlalpan - Venustiano Carranza En estas demarcaciones se esperan temperaturas altas entre los 31 a 33 °C. Sábado 23 de marzo: utiliza bloqueador solar Se pronostican vientos con rachas de 40 a 60 km/h y posibles tolvaneras en el Estado de México y en la Ciudad de México. Eso no es todo, si planeas salir este día, no se te olvide cubrirte muy bien de los rayos solares, ya que se esperan temperaturas máximas de 30 a 35 °C en la CDMX. Domingo 24 de marzo: cúbrete del Sol Se esperan vientos con rachas de 40 a 60 km/h en la CDMX y en el Edomex. Además, se pronostican temperaturas máximas de 35 a 40 °C en el Estado de México, mientras que en la CDMX habrá una máxima de 30 a 35 °C; te recomendamos guardar paraguas en tu bolsa o mochila para que te puedas proteger del Sol y, de esta manera, no sudar la gota gorda. Recomendaciones ante el calor - Evitar hacer ejercicio al aire libre y exponerse al sol de las 11 a las 16 horas - Vestir ropa suelta de colores claros - Usar bloqueador solar - Cubrirse con gorra o sombrero - No permanecer mucho tiempo en vehículos cerrados - Aumentar el consumo de líquidos - Evitar consumo de alimentos en la vía pública - Mantener una adecuada higiene de las manos - En caso de consumir agua del grifo, hervirla antes - Consumir alimentos frescos como frutas y verduras y lavarlas antes de consumir Para saber cómo sobrevivir a la CDMX, suscríbete a nuestro newsletter: [ https://www.chilango.com/newsletter/](https://www.chilango.com/newsletter/)

author: nouvelobs.com
title: Salvador: la face obscure de la "guerre contre les gangs" de Bukele
text:
El Rosario (Salvador) (AFP) - Quelque 75.000 personnes ont été emprisonnées au Salvador dans le cadre de l'état d'urgence en vigueur depuis mars 2022. Si 7.000 ont été innocentées depuis, nombreuses seraient encore derrière les barreaux sans preuves, selon des ONG, dévoilant la face obscure de la "guerre contre les gangs" du président Nayib Bukele.
Si la criminalité s'est effondrée dans le pays d'Amérique centrale, des organisations de défense de droits humains comme Amnesty international ou au Salvador le Mouvement des victimes du régime (Movir), dénoncent détentions arbitraires, mauvais traitements, cas de torture et même des décès dans les prisons.
La suite après la publicité "Certaines arrestations étaient fondées sur le seul fait que les personnes concernées avaient des tatouages, un casier judiciaire ou vivaient dans une zone contrôlée par des gangs", dit Amnesty dans son rapport de décembre 2023.
Sandra, Maricela, Josefina et Irma, mères ou grand-mères de familles ayant en commun de vivre dans une extrême pauvreté, affirment à l'AFP que leurs proches sont des victimes innocentes des dérives de l'état d'urgence.
- "Des innocents meurent" -
Sandra Hernandez, 36 ans, mère de deux enfants de 17 et 13 ans, raconte dans sa maison sans eau ni électricité, à 50 km de San Salvador, l'arrestation de son mari, le 26 mai 2022.
La suite après la publicité "Ils l'ont accusé d'appartenance à un gang. Il n'avait pas de tatouages", assure-t-elle. En prison, José Medrano est tombé malade, souffrant d'insuffisance rénale.
La dernière fois que Sandra Hernandez et ses enfants l'ont vu, c'est lors d'un appel vidéo au moment de son transfert à l'hôpital pour une hémodialyse. Il y décédera le 26 mars 2023. "Des innocents meurent, pas les membres des gangs (...) Ce qu'ils ont fait, c'est instaurer la terreur, et ce sont les pauvres gens qui tombent", fustige-t-elle.
- "Peur qu'ils m'emmènent" -
Maricela Méndez raconte avoir été arrêtée chez elle, à Alta Vista, dans le nord-est de San Salvador, le 19 juillet 2022 et ses enfants alors âgés de 11 et 7 ans confiés à leur grand-mère.
La suite après la publicité "Ils m'ont accusée d'être une délinquante du quartier, la police avait un quota de cinq arrestations", affirme-t-elle estimant avoir été dénoncée sans preuves par des voisins.
Elle a séjourné dans trois prisons, dormant à même le sol, nourrie de simples galettes de maïs et d'eau sucrée. "Ils nous punissaient, nous battaient, ne nous donnaient pas d'eau". Enceinte lors de son arrestation, elle a obtenu une libération conditionnelle deux mois avant l'accouchement. A sa sortie, son mari l'avait quittée.
Cette mère de 35 ans qui travaille dans un salon de beauté dit ses enfants "traumatisés". "Lorsqu'ils voient une patrouille de police, ils pleurent, ils ont peur qu'ils m'emmènent à nouveau. Je ressens la même peur".
- "Ils n'enquêtent pas" -
La suite après la publicité Les yeux gonflés d'avoir mal dormi à côté du berceau où se reposent ses petits-enfants de deux et trois ans et demi, Josefina Bonilla essuie ses larmes.
Elle dit n'avoir "pas de nouvelles" de sa fille Stefany Santos, 24 ans, arrêtée le 2 juin 2022. La grand-mère évoque un conflit avec la famille du père, assassiné pour un problème de dettes.
"Elle est innocente. Ils arrêtent des gens et n'enquêtent pas", affirme-t-elle dans sa modeste maison de Soyapango, disant vivre grâce à l'aide de voisins.
"Ma fille est asthmatique et a des problèmes psychologiques. Je suis inquiète qu'elle n'ait pas de médicaments", se lamente-t-elle, déplorant qu'en un an et demi, elle n'ait pu lui apporter que trois colis de nourriture et de vêtements.
La suite après la publicité - Avenir "volé" -
Irma Garcia, 42 ans, dit vouloir parler pour ne plus se sentir "impuissante" après l'arrestation de son fils, bientôt 18 ans ce 7 juin 2022, dans l'atelier de mécanique où il travaillait.
"Depuis qu'ils l'ont emmené, je ne l'ai plus vu. Je ne sais pas s'il va bien, s'il est vivant", dit-elle dans sa chambre à Mejicanos, au nord de San Salvador.
"Mon fils n'est pas membre d'un gang, il n'a pas de tatouages, il n'a fait de mal à personne", assure-t-elle, évoquant une dénonciation anonyme.
"Ils arrêtent des jeunes innocents, ils volent leurs rêves, leur avenir, comme celui de mon fils", se lamente cette veuve, mère de trois autres enfants de 13, 15 et 21 ans qui dit vivre "avec l'inquiétude qu'on me dise qu'il a été tué".

author: 'Marina Rodrigues'
title: Sesi Taguatinga promove torneio de robótica para jovens do DF, Goiás e Mato Grosso
text:
Nesta sexta (6/12) e sábado (7), o ginásio do Sesi Taguatinga será palco do Torneio Sesi de Robótica First Lego League Challenge (FLLC), etapa do Distrito Federal, que reunirá mais de 200 crianças e adolescentes de escolas públicas e privadas do Distrito Federal, Goiás e Mato Grosso. O evento contará com 30 equipes, que disputarão vagas na etapa nacional, da qual sairão representantes do país em torneios internacionais.
O tema da temporada 2024/2025 é vida no fundo do mar, e as equipes serão desafiadas a aplicar conceitos de ciência, tecnologia, engenharia, artes e matemática (STEAM) para desenvolver soluções para problemas ambientais nos oceanos. A competição será aberta ao público, que poderá assistir às disputas entre robôs autônomos, além de conhecer os projetos inovadores criados pelos jovens.
Os visitantes poderão acompanhar as disputas no dia 6, das 10h às 12h e das 13h30 às 16h, e no dia 7, das 9h às 12h e das 13h30 às 17h, com cerimônia de premiação prevista para as 15h30 no Sesi Taguatinga, localizado na QNF 24 (Taguatinga Norte).
Desafios
A etapa de FLLC é chamada de "Submerged", fazendo referência ao ambiente submerso que os robôs devem explorar. Durante a competição, que ocorre em arenas temáticas, os participantes, com idades entre 9 e 15 anos, terão que realizar uma série de missões utilizando robôs criados e programados com tecnologia Lego Spike Prime. Um dos desafios envolve o lançamento de um tubarão de lego de volta ao seu habitat, enquanto outro simula a exploração subaquática com um robô submersível.
- Leia também:
[Alunos de Taguatinga brilham em competição nos EUA](https://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/euestudante/trabalho-e-formacao/2024/06/6884309-alunos-de-taguatinga-brilham-em-competicao-de-robotica-nos-eua.html)
Além das provas de robótica, as equipes serão avaliadas em outras três categorias: design do robô, projeto de inovação e valores essenciais. Na categoria de design, os juízes analisam o processo de criação e os testes realizados com os robôs. O projeto de inovação desafia os competidores a identificar um problema real relacionado à vida marinha e apresentar soluções viáveis. Já os valores essenciais englobam trabalho em equipe, descoberta de novas habilidades, aplicação de conhecimentos para um mundo melhor e promoção da inclusão e inovação.
O evento também será uma oportunidade para o público conhecer as equipes da Rede Sesi-DF de Educação, que estará representada por seis grupos: Aion-X, Albatroid, Atomics, Biscono, Lego Field e Lego of Olympus.
O FLLC, promovido pela organização americana For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology (First), busca inspirar jovens a se interessarem por áreas STEM. O Sesi é o operador da competição no Brasil desde 2013.

author: financialcontent.com
title: Silicon Valley Dental Center Introduces Specialized Services for Cutting-Edge Dental Implants Procedure | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Silicon Valley Dental Center unveils a groundbreaking chapter in oral health with the introduction of specialized services, focusing on advancing the cutting-edge Dental Implants procedure. This strategic initiative underscores the center's commitment to pioneering dental care solutions and setting new standards in the innovative landscape of Silicon Valley. San Jose, CA - Silicon Valley Dental Center, situated in the heart of technological innovation, proudly announces the launch of specialized services aimed at advancing the field of dental implants. This strategic initiative reflects the center's commitment to pioneering dental care solutions and redefining standards in oral health within the dynamic landscape of Silicon Valley.
Dental implants have emerged as a transformative solution for restoring oral health and improving the overall quality of life for individuals with missing teeth. Recognizing the critical role of dental implants, Silicon Valley Dental Center introduces a comprehensive suite of specialized services meticulously designed to enhance the dental implants experience.
At the core of these specialized services is a dedication to leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced techniques. Silicon Valley Dental Center employs state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and precision planning methods, ensuring a tailored approach for each patient. This commitment underscores the center's mission to provide patients with the latest advancements in implant dentistry, aligning with the ethos of innovation that defines the Silicon Valley region.
The specialized services extend beyond conventional dental implant procedures, encompassing a spectrum of innovative solutions. Silicon Valley Dental Center 's team of highly skilled professionals, equipped with the latest advancements in dental technology, brings a wealth of expertise to the forefront of implant dentistry. The center's approach prioritizes patient-centric care, addressing the unique needs and expectations of individuals in the Silicon Valley community.
Silicon Valley Dental Center's reputation as a forefront player in dental innovation is underscored by this initiative. By introducing specialized services, the center aims to elevate the standard of dental care, offering patients not just treatment but an experience marked by precision, efficiency, and excellence.
Patients seeking top-tier dental implant procedures are invited to experience the Silicon Valley Dental Center difference (See location ). The center's commitment to specialized dental services reflects its ongoing mission to provide cutting-edge solutions that prioritize patient well-being.
 Silicon Valley Dental Center
Contact Person: Dr. Hani Jamah DDS
Email: Send Email

Address: 5710 Cahalan Ave Building 8K
City: San Jose
State: California
Country: United States

author: Chris Dunker
title: Nebraska the only Big Ten school that doesn't sell beer at football games — for now
text:
When it comes to the sale of beer, wine and spirits at Big Ten football stadiums, a familiar refrain rings true.
There is no place like Nebraska.
This fall, with beer sales set to begin at the University of Michigan and the University of Wisconsin-Madison, the addition of four new schools to the conference, and with Northwestern University working alcohol sales into its plan for a new stadium, Memorial Stadium remains dry.
It's a distinction — along with being the only Big Ten Conference member that is not currently affiliated with the Association of American Universities — that University of Nebraska administrators have noticed.
"We are quickly becoming a club of one," said Chris Kabourek, NU's vice president for business and finance. "We need to ask ourselves why we're 1 of 18."
People are also reading… NU's top chief financial officer Kabourek resigns Nebraska volleyball's next two matches are against teams ranked higher in the national poll Amie Just: Nebraska's loss to Illinois feels more like disaster than disappointment Sound waves: What others are saying about Nebraska's overtime loss to Illinois Foxtail Meadows touted as a new model for affordable housing in southwest Lincoln Charlie Burton, Lincoln's most acclaimed musician of ’70s and ’80s, dies at 73 Nebraska high school football rankings, Sept. 16 Dozens voice concerns at heated 'pink postcard' tax hearing for LPS Sound waves: What others are saying about Nebraska's win vs. Northern Iowa Greg Sharpe to miss Nebraska football call Friday as UNL lecturer, local broadcaster fills in No. 5 Nebraska volleyball dominant in sweep of No. 2 Stanford Nebraska lawmakers face renewed pressure to back winner-take-all election system Nebraska pool company stripped of business license for deceptive practices Grades: Illinois 31, Nebraska 24 Nebraska's top election official tells court irregularities could disqualify marijuana petitions Since 2012, when the University of Minnesota became the first Big Ten school to sell beer during college football games, more and more members have also taken a similar leap.
